text: The 1926 Paris international women's athletics meeting was an international women's athletics competition in Paris, France organized by the International Women's Sports Federation. The meeting was held on 3 October 1926 at the Stade Pershing and included athletes from France, Sweden, Germany and Great Britain. During the meeting British Edwards broke the 200 metres world record. ==Results== ===100 metres === Place Athlete Time Note 1 12.6 sec =WR 2 3 4 ===Shot put (4kg)=== According to Sportswereld Place Athlete Distance Note 1 10.045 m 2 3 4 4 Sources: According to La Derniere Heure Place Athlete Distance Note 1 10.45 m 2 9.96 m 3 9.50 m ===High jump=== Place Athlete Height Note 1 or 1.46 m. 2 3 4 ===Discus throw=== Place Athlete Distance Note 1 32.615 m or 35.75 m 2 32.58 m or 34.06 m NR 3 31.27 or 31.29 m 4 30.89 ===200 metres === Place Athlete Time Note 1 26.0 sec WR 2 26.2 sec 3 or 27.4 (Haux) 4 ===1000 metres === Place Athlete Time Note 1 3:15.2 2 3 4 3:16.8 === 4 x 100 metres relay=== Place Team Time 1 Lilli Henoch Emmi Haux 50.2 2 ===National events=== ====83 metres hurdles (national) ==== In newspapers this event was named the Laloz Challenge.
